title: Write-in Fund
description:
There are lots of giving opportunities and sometimes it’s difficult to locate the exact fund you’re looking for. If you’d like, you can follow the steps below to write in the fund you intend your gift to go to, and our internal processing team will work to direct your gift to the most appropriate fund.

  1. Select or enter the amount you wish to give, and whether or not this gift is in memory or in honor of someone.
  2. Use the Comments box to write in the fund name, description, allocation number (if you know it), and any other details that will help us direct your gift to the appropriate fund.
  3. Add the gift to your Gift Basket and continue browsing, or click “Give Now” to complete your donation.

title: CU Scholarship License Plate Fund
description:
Obtaining a CU license plate in the state of Colorado is a three step process.

Step 1: Make a scholarship donation to the Alumni Association of at least $50.

Step 2: You will receive the State of Colorado certification (separate from the gift confirmation email) within 1 business day. Print this email or show it to the clerk at the DMV.

Step 3: Pay the required DMV fee for obtaining specialty plates (currently $50).

title: CU Denver Alumni License Plate Program
description:
To provide support for scholarships at the University of Colorado Denver through the purchase of a license plate.

Obtaining a CU license plate in the state of Colorado is a three step process.

Step 1: Make a scholarship donation to CU Denver Alumni of at least $50.

Step 2: You will receive the State of Colorado certification (separate from the gift confirmation email) within 1 business day. Print this email or show it to the clerk at the DMV.

Step 3: Pay the required DMV fee for obtaining specialty plates (currently $50).

title: CU Anschutz Alumni License Plate Fund
description:
To fund scholarships for students at the Anschutz Medical Campus.

Obtaining a CU license plate in the state of Colorado is a three step process.

Step 1: Make a scholarship donation to the Alumni Association of at least $50.

Step 2: You will receive the State of Colorado certification (separate from the gift confirmation email) within 1 business day. Print this email or show it to the clerk at the DMV.

Step 3: Pay the required DMV fee for obtaining specialty plates (currently $50).

marketing_content:
Reach Your Peak students have strong potential to succeed and the scholarship helps them make it to graduation.

Through December 31st, gifts to this fund will be matched dollar for dollar by a generous donor.

title: Cancer Research General Fund
description: To support cancer research at the University of Colorado Anschutz Medical Campus.
marketing_content:
As the leading academic medical center in the Rocky Mountain region, CU Anschutz measures our success by helping patients live longer, better lives. Every contribution supporting the Fund for Excellence is put to work immediately to advance research, education and patient care at the CU Cancer Center.

Your tax-deductible gift will help us deliver the best care today, while reinventing the care of tomorrow.

If you’d like to search for more specific funding opportunities, please click here.

title: Bridge Forward Scholarship Endowment
description: To provide scholarship awards at the University of Colorado Colorado Springs for undergraduate students with an Expected Family Contribution up to 250% above Pell Grant eligibility or similar financial need program.
marketing_content:
Double your impact today!

Your commitment to hard-working students will inspire possibilities now and leave a mark well into the future. Thanks to a generous alumni donor, each gift will be matched dollar for dollar!

 

Gifts to this fund are made available for immediate use for Bridge Forward scholarship awards and are not invested as part of the endowment. Click here to make a gift to the endowment.

title: Office of Student Life Food Pantry Fund
description: To provide non-perishable food to be accessed by qualifying student recipients on the University of Colorado Denver Campus.
marketing_content: To provide non-perishable food to be accessed by qualifying student recipients on CU Denver Campus.

title: CU Denver Fund for Excellence Fund
description: To provide flexible support to address the campus's most promising priorities in enhancing student success and CU Denver's prominence as an institution of higher education.
marketing_content: To provide a flexible funding source that addresses the campus’s most promising priorities, particularly enhancing student success and raising CU Denver’s prominence as an institution of higher education.

title: CU Denver Scholarship Fund
description: To support general scholarships at the University of Colorado Denver.
marketing_content:
To browse other scholarship options, click here.

Gifts to the CU Denver Scholarship Fund will be matched to double your impact! 

As a result of a grant from the Colorado Opportunity Scholarship Initiative (COSI), the first $99,191 in gifts to the CU Denver Scholarship Fund will be matched 1:1.

title: UCCS Faculty and Alumni Scholarship Fund
description: To provide scholarship awards at the University of Colorado Colorado Springs for undergraduates who meet the same need-based selection criteria as the Bridge Forward Scholarship.
marketing_content:
Several current and past UCCS faculty have worked together to create this fund in support of UCCS students who work to help pay their way through school.

Contribute today, and your gifts will be matched dollar-for-dollar through a pool of $100,000 matching dollars.

Contribute today, and your gifts will be matched dollar-for-dollar through a pool of $100,000 matching dollars.
Scroll down to start your gift.

Faculty supporters shared:

"As your former faculty, we know most of you worked when we had you in class. In UCCS history, there has never been a time when there are so few student jobs available in our community. Our working students face a very difficult time. UCCS, unlike some other universities, is not cutting scholarships. However, hundreds of our students report they have lost their community jobs, many of which were in business sectors hit hardest including restaurants, retail and the tourism industry.
As long-standing faculty members, we ask you join us now in supporting scholarships for these deserving students so they can return and attend UCCS in Fall 2020. No gift is too small. This is our time to build a special legacy for the future."
Dr. Peg Bacon
Jacqueline R. Berning, PhD, RD, CSSD
R. (Dan) Dandapani, Ph.D.
Jeffery M. Ferguson, Ph.D.
Andrea Herrera
Sylvia L. Mendez, PhD
Sara Honn Qualls, Ph.D., ABPP
Joan Klingel Ray, PhD
Allen M. Schoffstall
Terry Schwartz, Ph.D.
Pam Shockley-Zalabak
Constance Staley
Dr. Barbara Swaby

 


×

title: CU Anschutz Fund for Excellence
description: To provide a flexible funding source to address CU Anschutz's most promising priorities in support of research, education and patient care.
marketing_content:
As the leading academic medical center in the Rocky Mountain region, CU Anschutz measures our success by helping patients live longer, better lives. Every contribution supporting the Fund for Excellence is put to work immediately to advance research, education and patient care.

Your tax-deductible gift will help us deliver the best care today, while reinventing the care of tomorrow.

If you’d like to search for more specific funding opportunities, please click here.

title: Officer Garrett Swasey Scholarship
description:
UCCS Police Officer Garrett Swasey was tragically killed in the line of duty on November 28, 2015. This fund will permanently fund scholarships in his name and continue his legacy of giving back to UCCS.

To honor his spirit and contributions to the UCCS community, hundreds of individuals have contributed to the Officer Garrett Swasey Scholarship Fund and surpassed our initial goal of $50,000. This outpouring of support has inspired us to raise our goal to $100,000 and continue to broaden the impact of that legacy. Your generous contributions show that Officer Swasey’s courage will never be forgotten!

title: CUREC Partnership Fund
description:
To provide support for the CU Real Estate Center, I/my company would like to become a CU Real Estate Council member at the following level:

  • Title Partner - $30,000 annually
  • Platinum Partner - $15,000 annually
  • Gold Partner - $10,000 annually
  • Silver Partner - $6,500 annually
  • Bronze Partner - $2,500 annually
  • Non-Profit Partner – Complimentary
  • Professional Partner - $750 annually
  • Leeds Real Estate Alumni (1-5 years past graduation) - $100 annually
  • Leeds Real Estate Alumni (6-10 years past graduation) - $250 annually

All amounts over $250 should be filled in using the “Other Amount” option.

To see the benefits of each membership category, please click here.
keywords: Leeds School of Business,CU Real Estate Center

title: Investigator-Initiated Trial (IIT) General Fund
description: To provide support for Investigator-Initiated Trials (IIT) within the Cancer Center at the University of Colorado Anschutz Medical Campus.
marketing_content:
Cancer League of Colorado generously pledged $150,000 to match 2-to-1 every gift made to the Investigator-Initiated Trial Program, tripling your impact and accelerating cancer research at the CU Anschutz Medical Campus.

If new and improved cancer therapies and treatments are the light at the end of the tunnel, clinical trials are the vehicles to get there. Clinical trials move research forward and help improve the quality of treatments available to patients. Investigator-initiated trials are “homegrown” ideas from researchers and investigators who are active in lab and clinical settings.

Cancer League of Colorado has pledged $150,000 to match $2-for-$1 the first $75,000 received by 9/15. Previous contributions cannot be redirected to the match. While you may direct your gift to another area, Cancer League of Colorado’s match will go to the IIT Program Fund.

title: Robert Damrauer Scholarship in Chemistry Endowment Fund
description: To provide scholarship support in the Department of Chemistry at the University of Colorado Denver, College of Liberal Arts & Sciences.
marketing_content: First preference is for undergraduate students in good standing who are in danger of dropping from the program due to an unforeseen circumstance. Second preference is for undergraduate students who have had to drop out of the program in the last five years due to an unforeseen circumstance and are now returning. Third preference is for undergraduate and graduate students who have demonstrated excellence in their chemistry studies and are planning to enter a Chemistry PhD program within a year.
keywords: College of Liberal Arts and Sciences,Chemistry
